results.title: Preparing simvastatin nanoparticles by a combination of pH-sensitive and timed-release approaches for the potential treatment of ulcerative colitis.
results.text_hl: Preparing @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ nanoparticles by a combination of pH-sensitive and timed-release approaches for the potential treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Colitis_Ulcerative</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003093 @@@ulcerative colitis@@@.

citations.NLM: Fardafshari F, Taymouri S, Minaiyan M, Tavakoli N. Preparing simvastatin nanoparticles by a combination of pH-sensitive and timed-release approaches for the potential treatment of ulcerative colitis. J Biomater Appl. 2022 Nov;37(5):859-871. PMID: 35999010
citations.BibTeX: @article{35999010, title={Preparing simvastatin nanoparticles by a combination of pH-sensitive and timed-release approaches for the potential treatment of ulcerative colitis.}, author={Fardafshari F and Taymouri S and Minaiyan M and Tavakoli N}, journal={J Biomater Appl}, volume={37}, number={5}, pages={859-871}}

results.title: "Two-birds-one-stone" colon-targeted nanomedicine treats ulcerative colitis via remodeling immune microenvironment and anti-fibrosis
results.text_hl: A @CHEMICAL_Chitosan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D048271 @@@chitosan@@@-modified @CHEMICAL_Polylactic_Acid_Polyglycolic_Acid_Copolymer @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077182 @@@poly(lactic-co-glycolic acid)@@@ nanoparticle (@CHEMICAL_Cesium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002586 @@@CS@@@-@CHEMICAL_Polylactic_Acid_Polyglycolic_Acid_Copolymer @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077182 @@@PLGA@@@ NP) system was developed for co-delivering patchouli @CHEMICAL_Alcohols @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000438 @@@alcohol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ to the inflamed colonic epithelium to alleviate the symptoms of @<m>DISEASE_Colitis_Ulcerative</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003093 @@@ulcerative colitis@@@ via remodeling immune microenvironment and anti-@DISEASE_Fibrosis @DISEASE_MESH:D005355 @@@fibrosis@@@, a so-called "two-birds-one-stone" nanotherapeutic strategy.

citations.NLM: Zhang J, Ou A, Tang X, Wang R, Fan Y, Fang Y, Zhao Y, Zhao P, Chen D, Wang B, Huang Y. "Two-birds-one-stone" colon-targeted nanomedicine treats ulcerative colitis via remodeling immune microenvironment and anti-fibrosis J Nanobiotechnology. 2022 Aug 30;20(1):389. PMID: 36042499
citations.BibTeX: @article{36042499, title={"Two-birds-one-stone" colon-targeted nanomedicine treats ulcerative colitis via remodeling immune microenvironment and anti-fibrosis}, author={Zhang J and Ou A and Tang X and Wang R and Fan Y and Fang Y and Zhao Y and Zhao P and Chen D and Wang B and Huang Y}, journal={J Nanobiotechnology}, volume={20}, number={1}, pages={389}}

results.title: Ulcerative colitis after statin treatment.
results.text_hl: The development of @<m>DISEASE_Colitis_Ulcerative</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003093 @@@ulcerative colitis@@@ as an adverse reaction to @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ is reported, which, despite withdrawal of the drug, proved fatal.

citations.NLM: Rea WE, Durrant DC, Boldy DA. Ulcerative colitis after statin treatment. Postgrad Med J. 2002 May;78(919):286-7. PMID: 12151572
citations.BibTeX: @article{12151572, title={Ulcerative colitis after statin treatment.}, author={Rea WE and Durrant DC and Boldy DA}, journal={Postgrad Med J}, volume={78}, number={919}, pages={286-7}}

results.title: The possible ameliorative effect of simvastatin versus sulfasalazine on acetic acid induced ulcerative colitis in adult rats.
results.text_hl: This study aims to investigate the role of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SIM@@@) at different doses against induced @<m>DISEASE_Colitis_Ulcerative</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003093 @@@UC@@@ in @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

citations.NLM: Soliman NA, Keshk WA, Rizk FH, Ibrahim MA. The possible ameliorative effect of simvastatin versus sulfasalazine on acetic acid induced ulcerative colitis in adult rats. Chem Biol Interact. 2019 Jan 25;298():57-65. PMID: 30408459
